front.title: Reservation of f000::/4 for Structured Internal-Use IPv6 Addressing

abstract.t: This document proposes the reservation of the IPv6 address block f000::/4 for structured internal-use networking. This allocation extends the concepts of Unique Local Addresses (ULAs) as defined in RFC 4193, acknowledging the growing demand for a larger, more hierarchically organised, and clearly non-internet-routable address space for internal networks. The reservation of f000::/4 would prevent future conflicts with public allocations and provide operational clarity to large-scale, privacy-focused, or non-public infrastructures.
